values:
im so tired and tired of sleeping alone
this emptiness i cant condone
so hollow and cold and wasted through the bone
the morning light will find my lifes life gone

im picking at my brain with a telescope
shattered glass and rubber rope
shot down dreams like birds that sing
end it now, it's time to cope.
okay so did the little hugs things and i wasnt expecting to get any but now i have like 14..i think..if im reading the little thingy right..so who's giving me hugs?

*Names changed for protection and privacy

 

Yesterday, my brother and I went to church and rehersed for a play on Christmas eve, he was and usher and I was going to be babysitting the children whose parents came to see the play, the babysitting thing is called "care giving". For a while, I was sowing up the tattered puppets that were to be the animals in the play. They were pathetic, they didn't even really look like animals. Then we ordered pizza and after we ate, we went down to the Fellowship hall and stuffed bulletins. The must have been 1000 of them or more because my group did 450 of them and we had the small group. After that we went back upstairs and I sowed up some more animals while my friend Jen* was blasting music and videotaping everyone dancing around. When it was time to go, we all went over to my friend Shawn's* house. We had to fit mexican deep into Shawn's mom's car, lol. We played sports all day, then my brother and I went home, took showers and went back to Shawns house and got picked up to go to my friend Nikkie's* house for a party that night. When we got to Nikkie's house with alot of our friends from our church youth group we ordered 4 pizzas: two cheese, two pepperoni. We watched Napoleon Dynamite and Dawn of the Dead. We were having so much fun, it was a blast. I was laying on the floor right in front of the TV with my friend Kristy*. I was absorbed in the movie (Dawn of the Dead), and then I saw everyone get up and I followed.

Everyone was standing in a group with Nikkie's mom and Dad and we were told that our friend Shawn's father got into a car accident. Shawn's dad was the one that was supposed to pick everyone up and take them home. Nikkie's mom took Shawn to the hospital and my friend Jen started crying. I held her, closed my eyes and let the tears come silently.

Nikkie's dad took Jen, my brother, his girlfriend, her brother and me home. The whole ride, I held Jen and my brother held us and his girlfriend . Her brother was in the front seat. Everyone in the back just cried quietly. Towards the end of the drive, Jen started telling everyone that everything was going to be okay, she was not only trying to calm everyone else, but more so, herself. When we got to Jen's house, she kissed my cheek and I kissed hers and we all told each other to call in the morning. I watched her go inside and then we pulled out of the drive way, next stop, my house.

When we got home I thanked Nikkie's dad for the ride and ran inside and collapsed at the top of the stairs. I just sat there for a couple of minutes trying grasp what just happened.  My brother went out on the beach and after what seemed like forever trying to dry the tears, I followed him. We stood at the waters edge, we didn't talk much. There wasn't much to say. When we started walking back to the house we saw someone walking around upstairs. It was my dad. When we got inside we told him what happened and he consoled us for a while. My father and I had a long talk about mortality and death and just how real it was. Everyone has a day coming, no one is special. There are no immortals.

I told him to find me on the otherside.

Afterwards, I went to bed. When I woke up this morning, I called Nikkie's house, her father said she was still asleep, did I want to wake her up? I said no, it's okay, I was just wondering if she had heard anything. He said, "Not much, we think both of his arms are broken. I'll have her call you back when she wakes up." I said okay, thanks, and hung up. I told my grandparents the news. They were shocked.

Later on, I called my youth group leader, Noelle*, and asked her if I could come by the church early tomorrow to sow up the animals before the play. She said that was okay, and asked if I had heard about Shawn and Lidia's* (shawns' sister) parents. I said , yeah, I was there last night, what all happened? She said that Shawn's father broke his arm and a couple ribs. I said thank you and hung up.

About a half hour later, Nikkie called me back. I asked her if she knew what happened. I wish I hadn't asked.

She said that both of Shawn's parents were in the car and that his dad broke both of his arms and had a bad gash on his neck that they were looking seriously at, but said he was okay. His mom broke an arm and a couple of ribs. They were both in the hospital. Noelle stayed with the kids all night. The person who hit them was a drunk driver, he side swipped them.

He died.

I asked Nikkie where she heard all this and she said her mom told her, her mom was the one who took Shawn to the hospital.

She said she had to finish her christmas shopping, and that she would call me back as soon as she got home. I'm still waiting on that call. It's 2:43pm, December 23, the day before Christmas Eve. The 21st, apparently, was Shawn's fathers birthday.

Now that you have read this story, I would like you to do me, Shawn, Lidia, Shawn's parents, and everyone else a favor. To spread the awareness of drunk driving, please if you agree copy these lines into your journal.

If you are against drunk driving: What you think are harmless drinks destroy families. Don't drink and drive.

If you do drink, and this story has made you, if not stop drinking, than atleast be aware of what drinking can do: For the fallen families, I put down the glass. Don't drink and drive.

Thank you.
I'm seeing a therapist now.... yeah. i finally updated.

"three males searching for three female roomates. Don't have to pay rent, some household 'chores' required"



riiiiiight..i wonder what those chores would be?

okay, so im getting ready to finally close this website for today, and my beloved brother walks in and hits his head on the door mantle...and says:



"dude that was sick, but, anyways, kate, i gotta tell you the shit that went down today....




So, me and josh (our brother's cousin, he's 26 or somethin) go to Devil's lake to fix a dish 500 for these two lesbians. one was hot one was not. then we go to the bar and eat and drink (heh heh heh) and we gave the manager a really big tip and he refused to take it and then Josh was like "just take it" and he was like "yes sir!" all chipper like, so i go "neck!". Then we leave and go to like Melaina County or somethin to do an install for a super dish and the first job was to dig a hole in the ground to stick the rod in for the dish. So me and Josh are diggin and diggin and i just so happen to cut Melaina county's phone line in half....woops...so it takes us a long time to find the other end and splice it (put it back together) after we shocked our fingers on it cuz it had 50 voltz or some shit. haha. so after that i have to flip the switch on the breaker and while im doin it im lookin in the back yard and all these chics in bikinis are in the pool. im eyein them, they're eyein me and im tryin to look cool, twirlin a lil wrench in my hand tryin to look like im doin somethin and when i open the box a whole wasp nest comes flyin at me and stings me like three times on the arm! i fell and ran away like a littl girl while all the hott chics are laughin at me. so i ruined my chances for the day. *sigh* after that we installed the dish and had to beg the customers not to say that we were the ones who cut the phone line! they laughed and said okay. then we had to run a few errands and we got some soda's and we headed to Orbit Tech. When i got there, i was hollerin at this chic Erin (maybe ive got another chance?).................................(nope)...(she has a child and she's 21....fuck)...ANYWAYS! back to the story, so we leave and i had left the cell phone and my lighter there (i would have grabbed the ciggs though, i was gonna try and cop one) so we had to do a U turn and we turn on this Rob Zombie cd and we are listening to 'Living Dead Girl' and this goth freak rocker pulls up next to us and i am sippin on my soda while head bangin and i pull the soda away and it explodes all over my face and Josh and the car and the freak guy laughs at me. So, we get my lighter and the cell phone and we head home. The End."





"Neck."












LOL!!! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!
thats fuckin funny. i love my brother, he's so sick. he gets so many necks though. hahahahahahaha

okay, so i was sitting there reading A Clockwork Orange and listening to Tsunami Bomb, right? and then i get to thinking about the fact that that i have already missed 2 of the 3 orientations for the highschool im going to (Gibb's) and that im also going to be missing the 3rd one, cuz im going to be at warped tour. fuck! oh well, i'll just send my dad to do it for me, hahaha. i think im just gonna ask my friends what classes they are taking and make a list and give it to my dad. lol. okay im good. for a minute there my heart was beating really fast but in truth i dont really care....im just freaked im not going to know where to go for all my classes n' shit. hahaha, that'd be freakin hilarious. oh well, im going to be a freshman, so i'll probably just get ignored anyways. hahahahahaha. school...i hate it..lol, everyone gets all excited over the summer, 'oh oh, school, i cant wait, i wanna see all my friends yappity yap yap' and im just 'yeah.....no. i hate school, why are you forcing me back there' within two weeks everyone is all rag tag like and saying 'i hate school, get me outta here' and im just laughin it up, taking in the moment were i can proudly say 'i told you so!' haaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahahahahahaaa.

i was talking to my friend stefani about warped tour when the conversation led to this--

(sn's have been changed for privacy!)





Kate: i dunno, i've obviously heard of some of those bands but not actually heard them
Kate: lol, im so pathetic
Kate: ive known of the casualties for 3 years and never actually listened to them
Kate: and the same goes for a few of those other bands on there
Kate: thats so sad
Kate: lol
Stefani: the casualties are turning into sellouts
Stefani: their cd is in target
Stefani: i dont even like them anymore
Stefani: lol
Kate: lol
Kate: well then i guess now isnt a great time to start listening then huh?
Kate: lol
Stefani: haha nope
Kate: i hate it when bands sell out
Stefani: me too
Kate: especially when their founding morals are things like anarchy and hatred for capitalism and all that other shit
Kate: its totally contradicting their former selves
Kate: i bet if their old selves met their new selves, their old selves would kick the shit out of them
Stefani: its gay
Stefani: definatly
Kate: lol, i could rant about that for hours
Stefani: lol
Kate: i dunno, i just hate trends and bullshit and a need to fit in with the damn standards and a world were popularity rules your innermost emotions 
Kate: its not just in school
Kate: that shit goes on through with you, like we see in sell out bands today
Kate: lol, see
Stefani: exactly
Kate: thats why i have so much hate and anger aganst the little 'downtown poser punks' and the little goth kids, and even the hardcore kids at shows who disdain you for your looks because you dont look like them, and even though they say that they dont believe in popularity and trends, thats exactly what they are doing
Kate: discriminating people for how they look
Kate: they are now different than the capitalist pigs they disdain
Kate:no*
